thig3.5:1.1: “You cry ‘Please be living!’ in the forest.
thig3.5:1.2: Ubbirī, get a hold of yourself!
thig3.5:1.5: have been burnt in this funeral ground:
thig3.5:1.6: which one do you grieve for?”
thig3.5:2.1: “Oh! For you have plucked the dart from me,
thig3.5:2.2: so hard to see, hidden in the heart.
thig3.5:2.3: You’ve swept away the grief for my daughter
thig3.5:2.4: in which I once was mired.
thig3.5:3.3: I go for refuge to that sage, the Buddha,
thig3.5:3.4: to his teaching, and to the Sangha.”
